CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 6, 1940, pg. 12 reads: "Bill Robinson, Actor And Ambassador Of Goodwill, Spends A Busy Week In Smoketown - When the "Hot Mikado" Bill "Bojangles" Robinson came to town, Pittsburgh received him as a superb dancer, an unsurpassed entertainer, a 61-year-old man who has brought joyful tears to the eyes of millions of people. But Pittsburgh got more than the dancer, the entertainer and he comedian.  Shown here are some pictures of Bo as he identified himself with the civic and social life of he city, a veritable goodwill ambassador.  In picture...4. Bill as the Hot Mikado, surrounded by his dancing girls.
TitMainTitle: Copy of photograph of Bill "Bojangles" Robinson and female cast members wearing Japanese inspired costumes on stage during production of "The Hot Mikado" with pagoda painted on wall in background, Nixon Theater
